result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Attorney Simon requesting that he be permitted to appear by Zoom at the upcoming status hearing.

9:41 AM Defendant Christopher W Pender in court.  Attorney Thomas C Simon Aty in court for Christopher W Pender.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for status. 
Defense has received discovery and an offer. State has offer to amend with treatment. 
Defense requests plea and sentencing with time allowed for defendant to complete treatment.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.

08:22 AM Defendant Christopher W Pender in court with attorney Thomas C Simon who appeared by Zoom.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Atty requesting to adjourn court date
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
